inn1.comm: pitches short of a length outside leg stump and Amla hops up to turn the ball off his hips into the gap at square leg to put a run on the board immediately
pitches on leg stump and he turns it straight to square leg
free runs for Gibbs as Bracken drifts well down the pads, all he needs to do is get a tickle on it and a running fine leg fielder cannot cut it off
better delivery, short of a length on and around off stump, Gibbs jumps back and fends it to the off side with one hand
pitches outside leg stump and curls in, Gibbs turns it to midwicket
fuller in length and that tempts Gibbs to chip in the air, its a loose, mistimed stroke but he goes over mid-on's head and all is safe for South Africa after the first over
begins will a full delivery, swinging away gently, which Amla jabs at and finds the outside edge that runs past second slip
back of a length outside off stump and no shot offered
pushes him back and again Amla edges past second slip
again a hint of swing, the ball pitches on middle and off and starts to do something, Gibbs comes forward and pushes the ball towards Warner at cover and sets off
pitched up outside off stump and Amla leaves it be
drags it wider and Amla forces it off the back foot but cannot beat Clarke, back in his role at backward point, he's immediately made his presence felt at that position
drifts down the pads, Gibbs jumps up and gets a bit of pad on ball
pitches and angles across Amla, who leaves it be for Haddin
and again it tails away off a full length and Amla watches it go
pitches just outside leg stump and Amla miscues the attempted flick off his pads, shuffling across the stumps
that hits a length just wide of off stump and then bounces and tails back to beat Amla as he flashes at it off the back foot
short of a length on leg stump and he flicks an inside edge off pad
141ks, pitched up and wobbling away and no shot offered
hits a length and that one is driven off the front foot to Warner at cover
a tad too straight, slanting in, and Amla clips it away past square leg
short of a length and he punches it off the back foot square on the off side this time, its a good shot but Clarke dives to his right and cuts it off, then allows the single
pitched up and now Gibbs pushes the ball to Clarke
fuller and straighter and that is on-driven down the ground to mid-on
pitches outside leg and swings in but Gibbs mistimes the flick

dropped in the deep! Gibbs walks down the track and makes himself some room, looking to tee off down the ground, but the length is not on for that shot and he gets underneath it and chips it high in the air to the on side, the substitute Cameron White runs back from mid-on and turns around to try and gauge the catch as it goes behind him, its very difficult to judge and he fumbles it just in front of the ropes ... looked like he had it covered all right, but ...
pitches back of a length defended off the back foot
much fuller and Gibbs whips that down to fine leg
pitches on a length and he plays it straight to midwicket
overpitches on the pads and Gibbs clips it to fine leg for four
pitched up and Gibbs drives the ball to cover
again Gibbs saunters down the track and makes an utter mess of the shot, spooning it up into the air and this time it is Hopes who runs in and settles under it at mid-off
comes onto the front foot and drives the ball to the off side
again pitched up and he drives it to the cover fielder
141ks, short of a length and punched off the back foot to cover
on the stumps and he goes back to turn it to midwicket
pitches full and angles away and he watches it go
gets a bit of room and cuts the ball to point, where Clarke dives
pitches even wider to draw the drive, Amla flashes and miscues to cover
lovely shot to one pitched up, just punched off the sweet spot but mid-off runs across and fields it
served up full outside off stump, tails back in and Amla leaves it be
hits a length and Amla comes onto the front foot and defends
comes forward and slices the ball behind point, late, for a couple
drifts down McKenzie's pads and he tickles it around the corner
hits a length outside off stump and punched to mid-off

141ks, swings in from a shorter length and McKenzie leaves as only he can, its more a beat in some ways as he commits himself to defend and only at the last second removes the bat as the ball tails after getting some lift off the track
shorter this time and he shoulders arms

banged in short and faster, McKenzie makes a poor attempt at a pull, taking his eyes off the ball, which then clips his shoulder and forearm and flies to cover, who takes the catch and appeals but the umpire shakes his head
back of a length and defended
starts off full and wide, 138ks, and Amla leaves it alone
pitches shorter this time and Amla hops across to off stump and goes for a cut, but can only get an under edge into the ground for his efforts
better-timed shot, hopping back and steering the short one past point
144.5ks, banged in short and McKenzie doesn't do much, taking his eyes off the ball as he fends for it, and cops it on the arm
another short-pitched delivery which McKenzie pulls out of awkwardly
overpitched on this occasion and McKenzie squeezes it to third man
another short delivery just outside off, and he pulls and misses
pitches on a good length with some gentle away swing and that one is left alone, though he had committed himself to a forward defensive
pitches on a length, McKenzie inches forward and runs it to slip
good shot from McKenzie, just walking across his stumps to get inside the line of the ball and then he flicks it from outside off stump and over square leg for four
pitches a tad wider this time and he leaves it be for Haddin
full and swinging outside off stump, defended off the front foot to point
overpitched outside off stump and Amla drives it wide of mid-off
short of a length on middle and leg and he glances it fine for a single
banged in short and Amla flays it behind backward point fiercely
swings across the line at one which is pitched up wide of off stump but cannot connect at all on the attempted pull shot

short again and not for the first time McKenzie loses sight of it and goes for a pull, the ball hits him on the glove and runs away into the off side, where Ponting collects and has a shy and cannot hit
cracked sweetly to the off side where Warner dives and intercepts
offered room outside off stump, McKenzie runs it to Johnson at third man
pitches full and closer to the stumps, driven into the off side
clever shot from Amla! Hilfenhaus bounces it in well wide of off stump and Amla hops up and uppercuts with a thick top edge that flies over third man and into the boundary board
hits a length outside off and he keeps this one out watchfully to the off side
too straight so he tickles it down to fine leg for a single
leans into a good-looking drive but cannot beat Warner in the covers
142ks, pitches on a length and goes away and McKenzie leaves

banged in short down leg stump and McKenzie wafts at it, the ball narrowly misses brushing his forearm and instead clips a bit of his shirt en route to Haddin, they all appeal but the umpire gets it correct
down the stumps again and this time he turns it past square leg
pitches it up outside off stump and he drives it straight to cover
hits a length and Amla gets to the pitch to thrash it through the covers
pitched up in search of swing, Amla cracks it off the front foot to cover
short and wide and cut but Clarke flings around with a great dive to his left
pitched up outside off stump, this time no stroke offered
bouncer over the stumps, 124.5ks, and he ducks under it safely
oh, that was close! McKenzie walks down the pitch and drives on the rise to cover,  but the ball dies just in front of a diving Warner at cover, it was very close indeed
a more conservative approach from McKenzie this time, coming onto the front foot and opening the face to steer the ball fine but he cannot pick the gap on the off side
edged and gone! Success for Hopes in his first over, courtesy another walk down the track from McKenzie, playing a loose flash and getting a genuine outside edge to Haddin
pitches back of a length and Amla gracefully steers it off the back foot and into the gap behind Clarke at backward point
short down the stumps and he deflects it off the pads to fine leg
banged in shorter outside leg stump and AB hops up to deflect
another nasty one sits up and surprises AB, who fends at it with one hand and plays it off the arm towards Haddin, that ball fairly jagged into his ribs and will sting
back of a length and swinging back in and he AB pushes it back
pitched up, AB drives at it and inside-edges back to the on side
pokes at a short one outside off and gets under-edges into the ground
well bowled, that one pitched short of a length and seamed away from the bat after Amla got up on the toes and went fishing
pitches fuller on off stump and Amla pushes it uppishly to cover
too straight and he tucks it off the stumps past square leg
short delivery bounces too much, Amla pulls out and a wide is called
forces him onto the back foot and Amla steers it to down to third man
walks well outside off stump and ends up defending the ball back
takes it on the half-volley and drives to a livewire Clarke at backward point
onto the front foot again, flashing square into the off side, Clarke intercepts
short-pitched just outside leg stump and he hops up to turn it away
short of a length and he gets back and across to defend
a bit too much width and AB laces that into the gap in front of point
pitches on middle and leg and Amla pushes it back to Johnson
back of a length and AB uses the width to dab the ball through gully
pitches just outside off stump and nips back in to beat the attempted flick and hits him above the knee roll, then AB calls Amla across for the run even as Hopes runs across
serves it up wide and AB walks into the shot, driving square to point
pitches back of a length and he gets across to defend it back
digs it in short down the stumps, AB goes for the pull and mistimes it
pitches it up this time outside off stump and Amla leans into a hard drive, on the rise and through a diving cover, Warner runs after it and cuts it off with an athletic stop
tossed up on the stumps and that it is turned into the gap at midwicket
flat on middle and leg and AB twirls it wide of square leg
holds back the length so Amla makes room and punches it away
tossed up and he drives it into the gap for one
drifts down leg stump
gives it some air and AB punches it back to Clarke
comes forward on the drive and places the ball into the covers
just back of a length outside off stump and AB gently turns it to square leg
the length forces Amla onto the back foot and he defends to point
slower ball, served up full, Amla flashes at it and misses all ends up
beaten again, this time as Amla arcs his back and opens the face in an attempt to open the face and steer the short ball over Haddin and down to third man
another short-pitched delivery and this time Amla succeeds on that shot, bending himself backward and dabbing the ball off the face well wide of Haddin
change of pace, a fuller delivery, AB gets over it and runs the ball to gully
tosses it up on off stump and AB drives it back down the track
tossed up again, wider, and AB drives it to point
comes forward and drives the ball down past mid-off for one
uses his feet, collects on the full, and on-drives another single
goes back and across and ends up pushing the ball back
comes forward and drives but cannot beat the cover region
pitches on middle and off and he drives it toward midwicket
cracks a full and wider one on the walk, square on the off side, but Clarke dives around and cuts it off superbly, he's such a great fielder to have in that area
drifts too far from the stumps

slower ball, full outside off stump, Amla gets the wrists into play, turning the ball into the midwicket region, Hilfenfaus runs in and collects form mid-on and has a shy but the batsmen are too quick on that superb tip-and-run
another tap to the on side and they call for the urgent single
pitches on leg stump and turned to square leg
114ks, Amla turns it from off stump down past square leg
tossed up and turned from middle and off towards square leg
makes room for himself and drives down the ground past mid-on, raising what has been an entertaining half-century
tossed up, AB plants the front foot forward and square-drives one
gently flighted on off stump, Amla pushes into the gap at cover and point and sets off, AB is sprightly and urges him on the for the second and they beat the sluggish return throw
quicker, flatter and shorter and Amla cuts it off the back foot
makes room to the on side and plays an inside-out square drive
short of a length on the stumps, AB shuffles and flicks it away
not sure what Ponting told his bowler, but Johnson has run in and sprayed that well wide of the stumps, forcing Haddin to leap around and stop it running way for four
overpitched on Amla's pads and he flicks it in the air over square leg
more poor stuff from Johnson after the chat with his skipper, he bounces that down leg stump and AB swivels and hooks it for a one-bounce boundary to fine leg
follows up with a full delivery which AB drives off the front foot to cover
overpitched wide of the stumps, AB gets back and cuts through cover
143ks, full outside leg stump and AB clips behind square leg
tossed up on off stump, AB comes out and drives to cover
gets to the pitch of that tossed up delivery and punches to extra cover
fuller and flatter on about leg stump and AB drives it to midwicket
tossed up outside off, driven to point, David Hussey throws and misses
tossed up slower, inviting Amla to push off the front foot into the off side
lobs it up again and AB square-drives to Hussey at backward point
hits a length and Amla plays that into the off side
also pitches outside off stump and AB plays it straight to cover
comes forward and flicks the full ball from outside off stump into the air wide of midwicket and mid-on, all wrists, and Hilfenhaus does the chasing
pitches wider, Amla steers it down to a tumbling Hopes at third man
short and wide and he forces it off the back foot, behind point for one
full and wide and thats slashed off bent knee into the covers
tossed up and he works the ball wide of midwicket out to the sweeper
tossed up on middle and off and he punches it to the on side
another push down the ground, mid-on fields and AB gets sent back
four balls in a row, driven into the on side, this time for into the gap
just to change the trend, AB makes room and drives into the off side now
ah, normal service restored, courtesy Amla who turns the ball to the on side
starts off short and wide but Amla under-edges the cut shot
short again, this time down leg stump, and he pulls past square leg
short and wide again and cut off the back foot square on the off side
gently flighted up outside off, AB gets across and clips it to midwicket
tossed up wider and Amla drives to Hilfenhaus at extra cover
tossed up on the stumps and patted down towards mid-on
back of a length outside off stump, Amla runs it to backward point
takes a step down the track and clips a fuller delivery past square leg, the fielder dives and throws it back but the batsman is just home safe
pitches full and he eases the drive to extra cover
opens the face and steers it down past backward point for one
pitches on a length, Amla gets over it and steers toward third man
beautifully played by AB, walking across the stumps to glance the full ball off leg stump and beat the fine-leg fielder
tossed up on middle and leg, Amla uses his feet and on drives
pitches on middle and leg and he clips the ball to the on side
tossed up to bring him onto the off side and AB opens the face at the last second, opening the face to steer it down to third man, excellent placement there
dances down and collects on the full, clipping in the air over midwicket
comes onto the front foot and steers the ball into the gap
chips it back in the air but it just doesn't carry to the bowler
pitches full to bring Amla forward, he opens the face and steers fine
angles back in off a short length, AB hops across the stumps and misses the ball as it stays low, struck well outside the line of impact
gets some room and hits the ball into the gap in the covers
pitches wide of the stumps and Amla punches square on the off side
comes onto the front foot and dabs the ball wide of backward point
slants back from wide and he opens the face to run it fine for a single
plants himself forward and turns the ball across the pads for one
tossed up fuller and he makes room to drive down toward long-off
drifts back in and this one is clipped down to fine leg for one
too straight and so Amla clips it off the pads to raise South Africa's 150
comes forward and flicks it straight to the other Hussey at square leg
rank short ball gets the treatment, pulled out to the sweeper in the deep
tossed up and driven straight back down the ground
pitches and drifts into leg stump, AB makes room and square-drives
flatter delivery and Amla goes onto the back foot and drives
tossed up on leg stump, Amla on-drives a single to midwicket
comes forward and pushes the ball back to Hussey
tossed up on off stump, AB drives straight to Ponting at short cover
flat on the stumps, clipped to midwicket, the batsmen stumble as Clarke dives to his left and cuts off the shot, but takes time to recover and allows the single
tossed up on the stumps and clipped straight to Clarke this time
uses his feet and flicks past Clarke this time
tossed up and defended to the off side for a quick single
tosses it up and this one is driven wide of extra cover
and there's another fifty for AB, tucked off the pads past short fine leg
makes room and slashes the full delivery into the covers for one
shorter one outside off stump which is punched to cover
fired in on leg stump and Amla drives the ball to midwicket
short and sliding down leg stump, AB gets across and tries to swat it off one leg but mistimes the shot, just managing a bit of glove on it to pick up a single
touch short on off stump, Amla goes back and steers to the off side
gets across and sweeps it from outside off stump, down to square leg
marginally short of a length on off and AB swats it past square leg
pushes him onto the back foot and he dabs it to third man
short outside off stump and this time swatted into the covers
banged in short and he tries for an uppercut but misses
comes onto the front foot and drives into the off side
chases the width and hits it hard but the off side cordon is strong
slides down the pads and AB cannot get bat on it
back of a length just outside off stump and thats pushed to the off
overpitched outside off stump and AB kneels down to drive to mid-off
short of a length and sliding down leg stump, in a flash AB gets up on one leg and swats the pall through square leg, Warner runs across and dives on the ropes in vain
backs away and drives the ball down the ground toward mid-off

pitches on off stump, Amla gently defends the ball, it proceeds to roll to the on side and AB sets off only to get sent back, Hussey collects at short midwicket and nails a direct hit, AB is home safe and then Amla calls him for the ricochet off the stumps, then up runs the other Hussey from mid-off and hits the stumps too, it is referred but all is well for South Africa in the field
caught in the deep ! Hopes bangs it in short, AB again swats it off one leg but straight to Warner at deep square leg, and thats the end of a positive innings from him
pitches on leg stump and JP pushes it back to Hilfenhaus
comes onto the front foot and dabs the ball backward point
bouncer down the stumps, 141.4ks, JP ducks under it
short of a length this time and he rides the bounce to steer it fine
change of pace, pitches on leg stump, Amla shuffles and flicks
banged in short, 142ks, cramps JP as he tucks it off the body
angles back in from outside off stump and he angles it past gully
swings too much down leg stump, Amla gets a tickle and beats Haddin
back of a length just outside off and he maneuvers it to third man
overpitched down leg stump and clipped down to fine leg
full again and this one is dabbed away but they can't pinch one
pitches and angles across JP, who dabs the ball to the off side
pitches it up and Amla plays a superb square-drive behind point, wow!
short of a length and now he calmly dabs it to third man for one
pitches just outside off stump, swings in, JP punches to the on side
short ball this time but he rides the bounce, dropping it past gully
full and swinging through the air, but wrong line and he clips it away
short on off stump, JP hops up and defends it to midwicket
well bowled, pitches back of a length, slants in and Amla blocks
flashes another wristy square-drive and backward point dives across

edged and taken and Amla goes for 97! A nothing stroke from Amla, standing his ground and trying to poke the short ball down to third man but the execution is poor and the faint nibble is snapped up by Haddin
welcomes him with a short ball, 129ks, Albie defends to point
off the mark second ball, steering a fuller ball past backward point
another short ball, wobbling away from JP, who pulls out of the pull
stars off short and rising outside off and Albie slashes over point
shortish on the body and JP turns it around the corner for one
pushes him back in his crease and he defends to the off side
woof! Thats dropped in fractionally shot and Albie picks it up from outside off stump and hammers it past midwicket before anyone can react
now he moves back and steers the full ball to Clarke at backward point
short and angling in to cramp him, but he adjusts and guides it fine
short ball on the stumps, Albie backs away and edges to fine leg
swinging yorker on leg stump, JP gets bat down on time and clips it
smashed! Albie makes room and carves the ball smack past point, that was firmly struck and he took it from middle and leg, mind you, Clarke didn't have a second to react and the ball was away
plays another shot, this time cramped, and Haddin runs in to field
moves away to leg again and this time swats it over midwicket
just like that! After the short stuff comes a full delivery on the stumps, Albie again makes room and swings, misses, and the ball takes out the base of leg stump
not the ball to bowl with this field, its full on leg stump and glanced fine
cheeky shot, walking across and paddling it up over square leg
full down leg stump, plenty of swing, and JP flicks in front of square
slower ball, full outside leg stump and he knocks it away for a single
again Hopes strays full on the pads and JP clips it past square leg
better delivery, back of a length on off stump and pushed to cover
what a shot, man! Pitches on a length in the slot and JP tees off with a brilliant swing, sending the ball back over mid-on's head for half a dozen, so cleanly struck
swings down the pads, he makes room and swings and misses
short ball and swung over midwicket, Marsh cuts it off in the deep
ah what rubbish, Johnson sends down a slower ball that drifts a mile down the pads and beats a poor Haddin too
brilliant, absolutely brilliant! Johnson veers straight and JP gets across his stumps to paddle that into the gap at fine leg for four more
full on middle and leg, JP shuffles and flicks to midwicket for one
drifts into van Jaarsveld and he tucks it off the hips for two
drops in short of a length and JP pulls it through midwicket for one
short of a length and angling in, gently on-driven for a quick single
takes two steps down the track and swings the ball out to Clarke at deep midwicket, it wasn't a short ball but he made room to make it one
stands tall and pushes the ball square on the off side for one
holy smokes he's spanked the pants off that one! Bracken holds back the length and has to crane his neck to look after the ball as it sail away flat over midwicket, spanking shot
slower ball on a length and JP punches off the back foot to mid-off
comes out and hits it inside-out in the air over extra cover, high arm and all, the ball is up in the air for a while and drops safely behind two fielders
low full toss on the stumps and he nudges it to the on side for one
pitches on a length and he goes back to pull past mid-on
bounces van Jaarsveld, who takes his eyes off and pulls out of the way
another short ball but too much bounce and wide is called

good catch gets rid of van Jaarsveld, who chips down he track and collects the slower delivery on the full but mistimes it in the air over mid-on, spooning it to long-on, David Hussey covers a lot of ground and takes a neat catch on the run just in front of the boundary
pitches on the stumps and he tucks it away for a single

slips in a very full and wide delivery, 134ks, JP chases it and loses balance and before you can say Jeff Dujon, Haddin collects and whips off the bails but replays show the batsman was safely back inside ... a brilliant take though
too wide and in the zone and JP carts that over extra cover for half a dozen, raising what has been an excellent and entertaining half-century, what a tour this kid has had
still full and wide and he dabs it down to third man for one
well, well, well ... JP's antics have rubbed off on his captain, who gets across and lap-sweeps that from outside off stump, at 140ks, and beats fine leg
gets a short ball on the body and pulls a couple through square leg
dances down the track and swings and miscues it to cover
well bowled and well played, Hilfenhaus fires in a yorker just outside off stump and Botha opens the face to steer it down to third man for a single
makes room and swings a length ball pitching well outside off stump, clubbing wide of mid-on and the sweeper cuts it off near the boundary
swings at a full one and gets an inside edge, Botha urges him on
full and swinging into the pads and Botha clips to midwicket
oh well stopped! JP backs away and absolutely hammers the ball down the track but Hilfenhaus sticks out his right hand and saves runs off his own bowling
full on the stumps and another single to JP, tucked to the leg side
bad ball, too full and wide and JP drives on the rise over cover, it looks like its going for four but Michael Hussey runs across and cuts it off superbly
full outside off stump and squeezed toward extra cover for one
that is a mind-blowing stroke from Botha, its a reverse-sweep against Bracken, executed brilliantly and beating short third man rather well
full on middle and off and on-driven for a quick single
serves up a full toss outside off stump which he carves for two
very, very full and wide and he reaches for it, poking past point

inn2.comm: starts off with one down the stumps, which gets some good lift
pitches on a better line, a foot or so outside off, and Marsh leaves
pitches on a length just outside off stump and hits Marsh above the knee roll, the ball was doing too much so a good decision from the umpire
140ks, lifting from wide of the stumps and he shoulders arms
sits up again from outside off stump and another raise of the arms
pitches fuller and swings away, Marsh pokes and then leaves
gets some room and slaps it down to Tsotsobe at third man
starts from off from over the stumps, hits a good length, Marsh defends
not even fractionally overpitched but Marsh eases it on the rise past mid-off
can't control the swing down leg stump, clips pad and beats de Villiers
overpitches on off stump and Marsh mistimes the drive back to bowler

sharp catch at short midwicket! Tsotsobe gets a wicket in his first over in ODI cricket, and it comes down to a good low take by Amla, because Marsh had flicked the full ball strongly off his pads but found an alert Amla plucking inches off the turf
143.6ks, pitches fullish and angles away and Ponting leaves
banged in short and it zips up for de Villiers to leap and take
again it gets good lift but wide enough for Warner to leave
142.8ks, again sits up off a short length and he leaves
oversteps, its a good delivery though, short and forcing Warner to hop back and push the ball to point ... still a free hit coming up
crack! Stellar shot from Warner, who just clubs the length delivery straight back from where it came, superb use of the blade from the young opener
back of a length outside off stump, wobbling away, and he leaves
short of a length and straightening off the stumps, Warner tries to nudge it fine but ends up getting squared up so he taps it back to Morne
pitches wide and shapes away from Ponting, who shoulders arms
lunges forward to a full one and squirts an edge wide of backward point
glorious stroke off the front foot through the covers, Tsotsobe pitches it up and Ponting thumps that on the rise past a diving fielder
hits a length and goes across with the angle, Ponting says no thanks
comes forward and dabs a length delivery toward the point fielder
not a half-volley but Ponting strides forward to get as close to the pitch as he can and then cracks a handsome drive off the front foot, bisecting two fielders on the off side
slides well down the leg side and de Villiers has some work to do
141ks, short of a length and impressive bounce through to AB
pitches it up, 146.6ks, and a swing and a miss from Warner
short of a length on the stumps, forcing Warner to go back and defend
banged in short on the stumps and he bunts it to the on side
good line there, hitting the seam and fairly springing up, Ponting leaves
too wide of the sticks and Ponting needn't chase those
pitches it up and Ponting drives it back to Morne, who fields well
short, wide and cracked just over the fingertips of backward point
fuller this time and he flashes a booming front-foot slash and misses
140.4ks, short of a length and Ponting shoulders arms
pitches just outside leg stump and swings back in, Ponting lunges forward and the ball thuds into his pads, there are two sounds as the ball rolls to square leg
pushed down the ground, mid-off runs across, Warner gets waved back and slips as he turns, no throw comes from the fielder so no hard done to anyone
pitches up up and angles it across Ponting, who chases and misses
slides down the pads and Warner swings it behind square leg
beaten again! Morne invites the shot with a full delivery outside off stump that swings, Ponting throws the bat at it and fails to connect
better from Ponting, getting to the pitch and driving past the stumps
back of a length on middle and leg, Warner hops back and defends
short again, sliding into Warner, who tucks it around the corner
pitches up and Ponting chases with an uppish push to extra cover
back of a length and cracked on the front foot to extra cover
comes onto the front foot and leaves one that shapes away gently

top-edged and well taken by de Villiers! Tsotsobe gets another, and a good one to get too, banging in a short-pitched delivery which Ponting top-edges back over de Villiers head, but he keeps his eyes locked on the swirler and pouches it as he falls onto his knees
full and slanting back in and Warner defends it back to Tsotsobe
seams back in off a short length and Warner defends to cover
tidy end to a tidy over, again short of a length and he defends to point
back of a length and rather wide of off stump, so he leaves
pitches full and a tad wide, Clarke leaves off the front foot
well bowled fuller ball, Clarke gets in line and pats it back solidly
played on ... or shall I say left on! Morne pitches it up and gets a hint of swing, Clarke starts to leave but doesn't twirl the bat out of the way in time and drags it back onto off stump
pitches on middle and leg and he turns it wide of midwicket first ball
short of a length just outside off stump and Warner pushes it back
much fuller and now he pushes it back with a full face of the bat
firm stroke off the front foot, Warner collecting the ball on the half-volley and steering it into the little opening between cover and point for a triple
pitches full to bring Hussey forward, dabbing it to backward point
nice ball there, nipping back off the seam and Hussey defends
full on the pads and excellently flicked wide of midwicket
bang, what a hit! Do not bowl on that length to Warner, because he will most likely punish you ... a super shot to one bowled just short of a length, flat-batted over midwicket
short this time, just outside off, and he taps to point and sets off
full on leg stump and he miscues the shot to the on side
pitches it up just outside off stump and Hussey shoulders arms
firm front-foot defensive to the off side, Warner gets sent back
pitches full outside off and swings back in late, Hussey leaves it be
full outside off stump and driven on the rise to the off side
short of a length, nips back in and Warner gets cramped for room
hits a length and starts deviating, Warner punches on the up to point
a clever yorker swings in late and Warner jams it out in time
pitches up a slower ball which Warner square-drives into the off side
short of a length and clipping in off the seam, pushed to point again
back of a length just outside off stump and he pushes it to the off side

another one, and the young debutant makes his presence felt immediately! Parnell overpitches, Hussey bunts it back dead straight, the ball flicks Parnell's fingers on the way down and deflects onto the stumps with Warner out of his crease
hits a length and he steers that one off the pads to square leg
short on the body and he hops up to work the ball to square leg
bangs it in halfway down the track and Michael pulls through square
fuller in length just outside off stump and he defends to cover
pitches full on off stump and a pleasing drive to extra cover there
pitches on the stumps and he plays the ball through cover
good, tidy bowling, hitting a length and Micheal defends
short of a length and dragged through midwicket for one
overpitched on off stump and driven back with too much bottom hand
pitches outside off stump and he runs the ball to backward point
short of a length outside off stump and he leaves it be for AB
overpitched on off stump and Micheal drives to extra cover
forces him back in his crease and he pushes the ball in defence
pitches on a length and curls in, Michael taps it to the on side
full on about off stump and he comes well forward to defend
short of a length and he pokes that off the back foot into the covers
tossed up and it lures him forward, then drifts past to beat the bat
tossed up and he lunges forward to drive it back to Botha
tossed up on middle and off and turns the ball to midwicket
flatter and angling into the pads and David plays it back again
starts to venture out, Botha spots him and holds back the length, David readjusts and pushes the ball in front of point for a hurried single
pitches shorter and slides back in, Michael gets back to try and pull but cannot connect, the wicketkeeper and bowler go up in appeal but the umpire shakes his head
pitches and angles away from off stump and David leaves it be
overpitched outside off stump, he drives on the rise but cant beat cover
a bit shorter and David clubs it from outside off stump past midwicket
pitches too far from the stumps on the off side
pitches full and he eases it off the front foot to the off side
pitches just outside leg stump and flicks it to midwicket
pitcher short of a length and no shot offered
tossed up down leg stump, he miscues the attempted nudge
flat on middle and off, he shuffles and clips it behind square
tossed up on off stump and he uses the wrists to turn it to square leg
comes onto the front foot and drives the ball to midwicket
fuller and flatter and quicker and Michael steers it to point
drifts straighter so he clips the ball to the on side
short of a length outside off stump and pushed away off the back foot
full on the toes and he clips it away in front of square
short of a length, angling away, dabbed off the back foot to cover
pitches it up on off stump, Michael pushes the ball toward cover
hits a length and he presents a full face of the bat back in defence
comes forwards and taps the full ball to cover and sets off for one
slowly thrown up on the stumps and Michael turns it to the on side
spins back in off a length and he steers it to van Jaarsveld at gully
comes onto the front foot and plays the ball firmly to midwicket
throws it up shorter and Michael forces it off the back foot to the off side
flighted up on middle and leg and he defends it back watchfully
drifts back into the stumps, deflected to the on side
pitches outside off stump, dabbed away to the off side for two
goes back and plays the ball away toward backward point
overpitches it this time and David loses a hand as he square-drives
comes onto the front foot and drives into the covers this time
leans into a good-looking cover-drive but JP flings himself around to stop
pitches on the stumps and stays low, Michael keeps it out
tossed up and defended back down the track past Botha
goes back and punches the shorter ball into the off side
drifts down the pads, turned to square leg
throws it up wider of the stumps and David carves it away
no much turn outside off stump and Michael cuts it away square
slower through the air, bringing him onto the front foot, steering to gully
throws the bat an one served up on off stump and inside-edges it
hits the upright seam on a length, Michael pushes it past point
overpitched outside off stump and driven wide of Botha at mid-off
full on leg stump, on-driven toward Botha for another single
flashes the bat at a full one, 135ks, and edges it to third man
137ks, back of a length, steered past point and the Husseys hustle
flighted down the stumps, he uses his feet and flicks past midwicket
thrown up on middle and off and driven to midwicket
comes forward and defends, struck just outside the line
comes froward and works the ball away for one more
tossed up and defended
tossed up and defended
overpitched outside off stump and bunted into the covers
on a length and tapped away for another single
comes onto the front foot and he plays the ball away
a boundary! Albie offers room and David slashes over the gap at gully, Morne runs in and dives but cannot prevent a boundary
comes forward and works the ball away for one
opens the face and steers the ball down to third man
low full toss on leg stump, turned away to deep square leg
pitches it short on middle and off this time, rocks back and pulls it to deep square leg
tossed up outside off, pushed off the back foot to short cover
on middle and leg, tucked away wide of square leg for an easy single
flighted on the off stump, gets forward and drives it along the ground to long-on. Fifty partnership, off 81 balls
a fumble at point allows them to come back for the second, just pushed off the back foot to point but the fielder there makes a mess of it
good length on the off stump, dropped off the back foot on the off side towards point
swinging into him there, short of a good length outside off, waits for it and chops it down towards third man
full on the off stump, driven firmly along the ground to long-off
short of a length on middle and leg, turned away to square leg
on a good length on off stump, pushed off the front foot to midwicket
shot, but there's cover, drives a half-volley just wide of mid-off where the fielder dives well to his left to keep the  batsmen to a single
fired in flat on the stumps and he pushes it away for one
tossed up and defended
tosses it up wider and Michael leans into a cover drive
full and flat on the stumps and on-driven to midwicket
too short outside off stump and he rocks back and flays it past point
spins back down and he turns it away in front of square
back of a length and dabbed away toward backward point
change of pace draws a thick outside edge, its pitched up on leg stump and Michael goes for the flick, but the offcutter goes on and he edges it to third man
full on middle and leg and he lunges forward as he clips it away
short of a length, he opens the face and steers it down to third man
goes onto the back foot and pushes the ball into the off side
overpitched on off stump and he clips it handsomely to midwicket
tossed up on the stumps and another flick to the on side
shorter and flatter trajectory, Michael goes back and bunts it wide
tossed up outside off stump and David cannot keep the drive down, instead hitting it straight to the captain who takes a simple catch at short cover
tossed up on leg stump, Haddin eases that off the pads for one
spins down the pads, AB collects and whips off the bails
short and wide but cut straight to Gibbs in the covers
goes down and heaves and inside-edges behind square leg for one
goes pulling a short-pitched ball and top-edges over the 'keeper
slower ball, 115ks, driven firmly off the front foot, Duminy intercepts
comes onto the front foot again and manages to thread the gap now
pitches on the dime and Haddin gets behind the ball to defend
pitches full outside off stump and he drives it back down the track
on the stumps and slanting in and he turns that to square leg
comes forward an essays a copybook perfect forward defensive
tossed up on the stumps and he clips it to the on side
offers room and he steers the ball backward of square leg
comes forward and clips the ball in the air wide of midwicket
slides down leg stump, Hussey goes for the flick but can't time it well
full on middle and leg, he adjusts and bunts it back to Duminy
on the stumps, dabs the ball to the on side, midwicket slides and fields
pitches full just outside off stump, Hussey pushes it back down the ground toward mid-off and calls for the single that raises a workmanlike half-century
short of a length, Haddin shuffles and turns it toward midwicket
slower ball, pitches outside leg stump, pushed to the off side
pitches full on about middle and leg, driven down to mid-off for one
pitches down leg stump, Haddin is late on the shot, stifled appeal there
tossed up, Hussey uses his feet and clips the ball to midwicket
forces him onto the back foot and he pushes the ball back to Duminy
fuller on the stumps and he mistimes the attempted flick but still gets one
comes out and drives on the rise to Amla at short cover
a shot of much-needed urgency from Hussey, who skips down and makes it a full toss, chipping over midwicket for a one-bounce four, just inside the boundary rope
fired in full and he drags the off drive back down the track
what a gem to start off with, pitching on a length and drawing Hussey forward, then the ball rips off the the deck and beats the outer edge
sits up again and this time he rides the bounce and dabs it to point
141ks, another steepler outside off stump, taken high by AB
miscues the cut shot, cramped up and under-edging into the ground
much fuller outside off stump and Hussey drives a single to the off
makes himself room and swings but cannot connect at all
throws it up on the stumps and Hussey pushes to the off side
tossed up gently and defended watchfully
thrown up again and this one is clipped to the man at midwicket
lunges forward and pushes the full ball to the on side
makes room and swings an inside edge past square leg for one
tossed up on the stumps and he clips the ball to midwicket
swing and another miss to one served up wide of the stumps
another nothing shot from Haddin, backing away and flaying at it
shuffles and brushes this one off the thigh pad, the ball balloons up in front of square leg and Hussey calls him for the single, and that is the 150 up for Australia
comes forward and chips the slower ball in the air over mid-off, Botha runs after it and tries to take it as it falls in behind him, but he cannot get to it and Hussey survives
pitches on the stumps and stays low, Haddin clips past midwicket
good shot, clipped off the stumps out to deep midwicket
backs away and laces it behind point, picks the gap, beats third man
comes well outside the stumps and works it past midwicket for one
throws it up outside leg stump, Hussey sweeps to deep square leg
fired in flat and Haddin can only tap the quicker one back to Botha
clears the front leg and hammers the ball along the ground to extra cover
thrown up on leg stump and clipped out to deep square leg
fired in at about a yorker length just outside off stump and Haddin, backing away, fails to get bat on it
super shot to welcome the debutant back into the attack, just comes out drives the ball over extra cover for maximum, thats the kind of shot Australia need from Hussey
low full toss this time, clipped wide of mid-on for two more
another full toss and this time Hussey doesn't disappoint, swinging at it and picking the gap at backward square leg, thats the way to deal with rubbish deliveries

what a comeback from Lonwabo Tsotsobe! Keeps his cool after being doled out for some punishment, holds back the pace and pitches short of a length, Hussey comes charging out and misses as the ball stays a touch low and knocks out his leg stump
pushes at one pitched up outside off and steers in the air past point

clean hit from Haddin, coming down to the pitch of a length delivery and depositing it rows back over midwicket, a thumper to end an expensive over for South Africa, but one which resulted in the massive wicket of Hussey
good use of the yorker but Hopes gets bat on it, squirting past point
swings the ball toward midwicket, where McKenzie tumbles
full on middle and off and Hopes swings it out to deep square leg

full on the stumps, clipped with an inside edge to square leg, confusion between the batsmen, Amla collects and has time to decide which end to throw, he goes with the striker's end but misses his mark with the Hopes not in the frame
clips another inside edge down to deep square leg
too full on the stumps and Haddin clubs it to deep mid-on
slips in a yorker down leg stump, Haddin backs away and jams the bat down on it and, believe it or not, picks the gap at short third man and finds the boundary
comes out and clips the ball toward square leg for one
gets a full toss on off stump and hits the ball down to long-off
another full ball in the zone and Haddin can only get one to long-off
backs away and drives the full delivery down to long-on this time
walks away toward square leg and bunts another full toss past cover
exposes the stumps and flashes a square-drive, except he can't connect
full ball on off stump, driven straight to the cover fielder
frees the arms and carves the ball to cover, straight to Duminy, who has a shy at the stumps and cannot hit them
attempted yorker, nice and full and straight, driven to cover
good placement from Haddin, making room to carve the ball in the air well wide of backward point, it bounces and rolls across the ropes before the sweeper can get there
full toss slides down leg stump and he chips it wide of midwicket
full and straight and he cannot time the ball away beyond midwicket
full on middle and leg, he makes room and drives to mid-on
another loose delivery from South Africa, a full toss, slapped past cover
poor bowling from Parnell, sliding it well down the leg stump
overpitched outside the pads and flicked to midwicket
slower ball down the stumps, Haddin sweeps a leg bye to square leg
another full toss and Haddin clubs it between midwicket and mid-on
flights it up slower and he swings the ball away to the on side
change of pace, a yorker length and he can only pat it back to Botha
of all things, Hopes has missed a low full toss! Botha serves it up and gets it to dip and Hopes plays all over it as he goes for a flick to the on side, the ball hits middle and leg
lunges forward and gets an inside edge to midwicket
throws it down leg stump and he swings the ball off an inside edge
slides down leg, hits the pad, loud appeal is turned down immediately
another full toss from the inexperienced debutant and Haddin clips it in the air through midwicket for a four that brings up his half-century, good shot to a poor ball
much better, full on leg stump and he clips it to midwicket
full and wide and he plays a great cover drive to the fielder
low full toss outside off, Johnson drives out past extra cover

change of pace, holds back the length, Haddin plays the short ball loosely in the air over midwicket, Albie runs back and van Jaarsveld runs in from the deep, the ball dips and lands between the two fielders and Albie seems to have injured himself on the collision ... it was a solid tackle, van Jaarsveld slid and collided with Albie, his knee hitting him in the side .. Albie gets some attention and is helped off the field by Shane Jabbar, the South African physio
yorker length outside off stump, 137ks, and it beats the bat
full outside off stump, pushed into the covers, runs and beats the throw
good clean hit from Haddin, clearing the front leg and teeing off down the ground, straight through the line, one bounce and four, superb shot from him
flatter on leg stump and Haddin pushes the ball to midwicket
fired into the blockhole and Johnson swings it to the off side
low dipping full toss on the stumps, Haddin sizes it up and hits it over mid-on, Gibbs does the cleaning up on the boundary
fires it in and Johnson nudges the ball to midwicket for one
swing and miss from Johnson, failing to connect to a full one

well now, a bit of confusion and Tsotsobe has four on debut! Clever bowling, fires in a yorker on leg stump, Johnson closes the face early and the ball pops back to Tsotsobe, who collects it and then feigns a throw back to Johnson, suddenly from backward point Gibbs appeals and gets Tsotsobe interested, it is referred, and yes indeed Johnson scooped a clean catch back to the bowler
pitched up full outside off stump, Bracken chases and misses
full on the stumps, pushed past Tsotsobe and they set off
very very full and wide and its duly called wide, beating slips as well
low full toss on middle and off, chipped toward midwicket
another heave and a miss from Bracken, connecting with humid air
heaves at one pitched up on middle stump, Morne collects at midwicket and flings a throw but he cannot make contact
makes room and he drives the ball to extra cover

oh he's missed the stumps! Parnel fires it in full and straight, Haddin bunts it back to him, Bracken is out of the crease by miles and all Parnell needed to do was run back and disturb the stumps but instead he has an underarm flick and misses by some distance
full and wide, Bracken reaches out and misses, AB fumbles and they scamper a quick bye to get Haddin back on strike
maiden wicket for Parnell, pitches in on a length and Haddin chips the ball up in the air, Tsotsobe runs after it from short fine leg and holds on near the ropes at fine leg
hits a full ball in the air over extra cover, Amla does the fielding
pitches outside off stump and he cannot connect cleanly
pokes at a length ball from the crease and just misses an edge
pulls a short ball, gets a top edge, AB runs after it but can't get there
full in the blockhole, he makes room and carves past cover
makes room and misses out again, that wasn't far from off stump
all over and we have a new number one in one-day international cricket! Bracken pulls a high full toss out to the substitute Steyn at wide long-on and South Africa win 4-1!
